posts.cooked:
Using Pathplanner on REV Swerve Drive. Code attached on github link. Autonomous ends about 0.5 seconds after it starts based on Shuffleboard. Any suggestions on how I can fix this?

2025PathPlanner

Team 8173's 2025 code for the FIRST Robotics Competition

image 1567×887 52.7 KB

image 1567×887 52.7 KB

image 1567×887 52.7 KB

posts.name: Troy Maurer
posts.cooked:
Hello, You mention that the path lasts for 0.5 seconds according to shuffleboard, but what actually happens during that time? Does the robot not move at all? Does the robot start the path but then stop halfway through? Or does the robot manage to complete the path in the 0.5 seconds? Also there may be a problem with the way you display the boolean for whether the autonomous is on or not. You have robot periodic continuously setting “Autonomous Active” to false, no matter whether the robot is actually in autonomous or not.

This is  countered by setting “Autonomous Active” to true in the autonomous periodic function, but issues may still arise.
The Robot Moves forward about 3-4 centimeters then stops.

After doing some testing, I figured out 2 problems:

I needed to repeatedly schedule the path in the “Autonomous Periodic” method of the Robot file

resetOdometry wasn’t working for some reason, so I chose to do it manually using a dedicated resetOdometry method at the start of the path

image 1912×961 107 KB Now I have a new problem, the robot doesn’t seem to understand that there is a significant amount of XY error when the telemetry pretends that the error is 0

image 1912×961 107 KB

image 1912×961 107 KB

PathPlannerAttempt2

Team 8173's 2025 code for the FIRST Robotics Competition

Here is the new branch I used for this testing

After even more testing, I’ve managed to get pathplanner to work about 25% of the time. Here are more things I found.

If I don’t redeploy the code and press enable on driverstation, pathplanner doesn’t run

If I redeploy the exact same code to the robot, pathplanner might also not run each time

posts.name: Troy Maurer
posts.cooked:
Sorry for the wait, I only check Chief Delphi consistently on the weekends.

You should not reschedule the command in autonomous periodic, this is what is likely causing the consistency issues.

From your getAutonomousCommand() function in robotContainer, you are returning AutoBuilder.followPath(path); You should try returning a PathPlannerAuto instead.
